item.title: Phasmophobia Brings "Genre-Defining" Co-Op Horror Madness To Switch 2 In 2026
item.content:encoded:
Stay alert

The multiplayer online co-op psychological horror title Phasmophobia is on its way to the Switch 2 in 2026. This was revealed during The Game Awards, and the team says it will include all of the content added throughout 2025.

Announced at The Game Awards 2025, the genre-defining co-op horror game Phasmophobia is coming to Nintendo Switch 2 in 2026.

You and your team of paranormal investigators will enter haunted locations filled with paranormal activity and try to gather as much evidence as you can. Use your ghost-hunting equipment to find and record evidence to sell on to a ghost removal team.

More details soon...

Liam is a news writer and reviewer across Hookshot Media. He's been writing about games for more than 15 years and is a lifelong fan of many iconic video game characters.

item.title: Video: New 007 First Light Trailer Introduces Lenny Kravitz As Bawma
item.content:encoded:
Out next year for Switch 2

IO Interactive is gearing up to release 007 First Light next year on the Switch 2 and multiple other platforms.

Ahead of the big release, at The Game Awards a new trailer has been shared introducing the singer and musician Lenny Kravitz.

He rose from nothing, broke free, and built his own Kingdom of Aleph.
Introducing Bawma, the largest black-market dealer in the Western Hemisphere who’s as charismatic as he is unpredictable. Brought to life by the one and only Lenny Kravitz.

007 First Light comes to PlayStation®5, Xbox Series X|S, Nintendo Switch 2, and PC on March 27th, 2026.

Pre-order now and get a free Deluxe Edition Upgrade.

Will you be checking this game out on the Switch 2? Let us know in the comments.

Liam is a news writer and reviewer across Hookshot Media. He's been writing about games for more than 15 years and is a lifelong fan of many iconic video game characters.
